items.content_html: Ugh. I hate that Google Meet requires Chrome and doesn‚Äôt work on Safari. Are we really going to go back to the proprietary IE 6 days???

items.title: Hamilton!

items.content_html:
We are at the Paramount seeing Hamilton. But I almost didn‚Äôt get to.

When we got to the theater only one ticket was in my pocket. So we walked back to the van to behold our other one on the ground behind the van in the garage. Thank God it was still there. That was terrifying.
If there‚Äôs a sazerac recipe you enjoy, I‚Äôd love to hear about it ü•É
My kingdom for a way to import Markdown into a properly-rendered Google Doc.
I won the Pearl Jam drawing for the Seattle shows on both 8/8 and 8/10! I‚Äôm so excited to see them this summer.
Got registered for the Pearl Jam home show ticket lottery. Really hoping we can get tickets on Monday!

Interesting behavior in @manton‚Äôs new Sunlit. I wasn‚Äôt expecting a story to equate to a blog post that gets updated. Feels like a Sunlit story‚Äôs entries should each be a micro.blog post. It‚Äôs a fun app though and I‚Äôm excited to see where it goes from here.

I really love it when stuff I‚Äôm trying to figure out just starts to click. I‚Äôm also a little bit embarrassed when it‚Äôs stuff that I feel like either I should have known about, or ‚Äúsomeone in my position would have known about it‚Äù. Hello imposter syndrome.
I decided last week to figure out how to get all of my commits to be Verified like they are on GitHub. It was actually pretty easy once I found this helpful blog post to guide me! Thanks Aaron!
I started the very bare bones of a Slack native Mac app about 18 months ago. Would anyone be interested in my open sourcing of it? I‚Äôm tempted to do it if anyone wants it.

That‚Äôs as good as a Super Bowl can get as long as the Seahawks aren‚Äôt winning it. Congratulations Eagles! I especially liked when we whooped you 24-10 with your golden boy quarterback. That was a fun night üòä
I missed the Solo trailer premiere, which was shown while I was changing a poopy diaper. The crap I endure sometimes‚Ä¶
Today we are all Eagles fans.

Tweetstorms should not be used in place of blog posts. I just read a really great chain of thoughts that I really wish was a blog post that I could point a link to, but instead I‚Äôd have to pick one or two tweets that I hope get displayed properly in your client of choice.
Throwing this out there hypothetically of course, but if I have any Apple employee friends who don‚Äôt want to use their HomePod discount, I‚Äôd be happy to take it off their hands.

I‚Äôm starting a Rubber Ducking group of text files to try to figure out solutions to my programming problems. In a completely open office talking to a rubber duck would feel super awkward. This should be a good replacement for pinging coworkers on Slack.
Sending a fax like it‚Äôs 1998, only on the internet because it‚Äôs 2018. Why do fraud places that handle ‚Äúsensitive information‚Äù think that this is still a secure way to send data?

I learned today that iCloud syncs iPhone call histories. I‚Äôve got a work phone that‚Äôs been buzzing with pages all week, and those calls are on my personal phone‚Äôs history. Crazy. And there‚Äôs no way to disable that sync as far as I can tell.
Ugh. Dealing with identity theft that you thought you‚Äôd taken care of years ago is the worst.
I‚Äôve really been enjoying The Omni Show, and am looking forward to listening to this week‚Äôs episode with Ken Case. Thanks Omni!
This seems to aptly sum up my week thus far.

items.title: Drinkology
items.content_html:
2018-01-30

Been getting into making Old Fashions lately. This one turned out quite nicely.

2018-02-07

I was told I should make a whiskey sour next. I don‚Äôt know if I did this right.

I see lots of people talking about the ‚ÄúSnow Leopard‚Äù releases of iOS and macOS as meaning focusing on quality. But Snow Leopard also had a 2 year lifecycle and spanned 10.6.0-10.6.8. Will those days of 2 years between major OS releases come back?

I really like this post from Manton Reece about how he‚Äôs setting up micro.blog. I took analytics off my site (which were meager at best) because after posting something, I‚Äôd check the dashboard regularly. I don‚Äôt want to be writing for the (nonexistent) numbers anymore.
